actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 14, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick moved that the House do now adjourn
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 996, H. Res. 995 is considered passed House.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214
actions-list.actionItem: 213 (Roll no. 43).

actions-list.header: On motion to reconsider Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216
actions-list.actionItem: 211 (Roll no. 42).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 863 — "Impeaching Alejandro Nicholas Mayorkas, Secretary of Homeland Security, for high crimes and misdemeanors."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 414
actions-list.actionItem: 11 (Roll no. 41).

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 5856, as amended, the motion to reconsider H. Res. 863, and adoption of the resolution if ordered.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5856.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (NJ) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5856 — "To reauthorize the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 13.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3202.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Lawler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3202 — "To prohibit any official action to recognize or normalize relations with any Government of Syria that is led by Bashar al-Assad, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3016.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Lawler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3016 — "To amend the Anti-Boycott Act of 2018 to apply the provisions of that Act to international governmental organizations."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 533.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 533 — "To amend the Tibetan Policy Act of 2002 to modify certain provisions of that Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4039.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4039 — "To prohibit the use of funds supporting any activities within the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of the People's Republic of China."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2766.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Kim (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2766 — "To support the human rights of Uyghurs and members of other minority groups residing primarily in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region and safeguard their distinct identity, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 13.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 13, 2024, at 9:05 a.m.: That the Senate passed H.R. 815 with an amendment and that the Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 29. Appointment: Member of the Advisory Committee on the Records of Congress.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 12, 2024, at 12:30 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 709, S. 1147, and that the Senate agreed to S. Res. 553. Appointments: Board of Visitors of the U.S. Naval Academy and the Senate National Security Working Group for the 118th Congress.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 13.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Celeste Maloy to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
